answers.answer: 1. It's not normal , why the heck would they say that ?2. I get like this sometimes but ill turn the hot water down and squat in the shower until I feel better , the hot water is dropping your blood temp.3. You may want to ask your Obgyn about having pre-eclampsia

Theres a thing called head sparing where blood doesn't go to your head like it should while youre pregnant and can cause dizziness. My doctor said to always call if I have fainted or go to the e.r. also the heat from the shower and or dehydration, and high blood pressure (or way to low blood pressure) and a sudden rise or drop in blood sugar can all cause dizziness/fainting. I would at least call your doctor and let them know what happened even if you arent going to the e.r.

I did that once while vacuuming with my last pregnancy and I ended up being induced for pre-eclampsia a few weeks later.  Definitely let your ob know at your next appt and start taking your blood pressure in the mornings if you have a cuff to monitor.  Do you have any other symptoms?

Thanks ladies I will be calling doctor tomorrow! I had preeclampsia with my first pregnancy but everything has been normal with this one.. also I've been feeling really weak.. I hope its not preeclampsia again

question: So earlier I was in the shower and started to feel really dizzy like I couldn't breath or see.. I fainted twice right after..I didn't go to the hospital because they always just send me back home and say "its normal" ..who else has had this?? Did you go to the er? What they said?
title: fainting? 30 weeks
